RHJ92CTA.question:
An aircraft on an IFR flight in IMC conditions, and flying in airspace where radar service is provided, experiences radio communication failure
	The PIC must set the transponder on 7600, maintain the last assigned speed and

options.text: level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter, he/she must adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter he/she must adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
initiate a 300 ft per minute climb until reaching VMC conditions, then divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.
turn right by 30 degrees if flying odd flight levels, or turn left by 30 degrees if flying even flight levels.

kaC4RkxK.question: When transmitting a message preceded by the phrase “Transmitting blind due to receiver failure” during an en-route flight, the aircraft station shall also...

options.text: advise the time of its next intended transmission.
return to the airport of departure.
join base leg when approaching the airfield for landing.
land at the nearest airfield/airport.

odUtjsSO.question: When shall the pilot of an aircraft experiencing communications failure keep a watch for instructions passed by visual signals?

options.text: When the aircraft is forming part of the aerodrome traffic at a controlled aerodrome.
When flying within a control area.
When crossing a FIR boundary.
When entering a CTR.

lDQQ3EMW.question: When shall the pilot of an aircraft experiencing communications failure keep a watch for instructions passed by visual signals?

options.text: When the aircraft is forming part of the aerodrome traffic at a controlled aerodrome.
When flying VFR above clouds.
When entering a FIR during an IFR flight.
When the aircraft is entering the traffic pattern of an uncontrolled airport.

NW6h5NED.question: During radio communication failure, an aircraft forming part of the aerodrome traffic at a controlled aerodrome, shall amongst other requirements

options.text: keep a watch for such instructions as may be issued by visual signals.
land without delay and vacate the runway and report the termination of the flight.
leave the aerodrome traffic and divert to the next suitable aerodrome.
watch such instructions as may be issued by other aircraft of the aerodrome traffic.

BTARiFhg.question: An aircraft is squawking 7600. This indicates

options.text: It is unable to establish communication due to radio equipment failure
They require directions to an air tanker
It is about to make a forced landing
It is diverting to the alternate aerodrome

9eSIwFZ9.question: Immediately after take-off, you are experiencing communication failure. What would be an appropriate course of action?

options.text: Join the traffic circuit to land and try to establish communication with ATC using all available means.
Proceed on the runway heading, level off at the minimum sector altitude and set the transponder code to 7500.
Set the transponder code to 7700 and proceed towards destination, in accordance with the flight plan.
Rock the aircraft wings and flash the navigational lights. at irregular intervals, to signal a communication failure.

B2LOlmZZ.question: An aircraft encountering radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC has to hold over the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome:

options.text: until the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.
5 minutes in any case.
under no circumstances.
3 minutes, if an expected approach time is not acknowledged.

7dW0IkRk.question: A message preceded by the phrase "transmitting blind due to receiver failure" shall be transmitted..

options.text: on the frequency in use at the time.
to all available aeronautical stations.
on the international emergency frequency.
on the regional guard frequency.

CYnoWlug.question: If all attempts to establish radio contact with a ground station fail, the pilot of an aeroplane shall transmit messages preceded by the phrase

options.text: Transmitting blind
How do you read?
Read you one, read you one
PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN

yEejyoGk.question: If all attempts to establish radio contact with a ground station fail, the pilot of an aeroplane shall transmit messages preceded by the phrase...

options.text: Transmitting blind.
Read you one, read you one.
How do you read?.
PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN.

fJNLm9Vw.question: An aircraft on an IFR flight, after experiencing radio communication failure in VMC, successfully lands at the nearest suitable aerodrome. What is it supposed to do next?

options.text: Report its arrival by the most expeditious means to the appropriate Air Traffic Control unit.
Report the failure by the most expeditious means to the responsible aerodrome operator.
Have the equipment failure repaired within 30 days by an authorised avionics repair facility.
Inform the relevant Civil Aviation Authority and have the radio failure repaired as quickly as possible.

dD4x53Im.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC and not expecting any approach delay must start descent over the designated navigational aid serving the destination aerodrome:

options.text: at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) resulting from the Current Flight Plan (CPL).
at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) based on the Filed Flight Plan (FPO).
4 minutes after reaching the Initial Approach Fix (IAP).
immediately after reaching the navigation aid in any case.

cjK1da0b.question: When an aircraft flying IFR in IMC encounters radiocommunication failure as it is being vectored or has been directed by ATC to proceed offset using RNAV without a specified limit, it shall proceed in the most direct manner possible to rejoin the current flight plan route no later than the next significant point. To do this, what has to be taken into consideration?

options.text: The applicable minimum flight altitude.
The maximum turn to return to the current flight plan route is 45 degrees.
Other aircraft from which separation was provided using vectors, as separation from other traffic becomes the pilot`s responsibility.
The deviations that may be needed to maintain visual separation from all other aircraft.

hrhOptD8.question: A pilot is flying under IFR in an airspace where radar is used in the provision of air traffic control. he/she is experiencing air-ground communications failure. The last communication he/she received was a level assignment. After reaching this level, he/she should maintain it for a period of how many minutes?

options.text: 7 minutes
5 minutes
15 minutes
20 minutes

VrUWEdc2.question:
Following a radio failure, the pilot on a controlled VFR flight tries to re-establish communications. All transmissions are preceded with 'Transmitting blind'. What must the pilot do after this phrase?
1. Set the SSR code to 7500
2. Repeat the message twice on the designated channel(s)
3. Include the name of the station being addressed
4. Deviate from the assigned route by at least 45°

options.text: 2 and 3
3 and 4
1 and 4
1 and 2

xNU2ehqj.question: Within the European Region, an aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR departure has to squawk 7600 and..

options.text: maintain the level last assigned by ATC for a period of 7 minutes and then climb in accordance with the flight plan.
land at the departure aerodrome.
maintain the level last assigned by ATC for a period of 5 minutes and then continue in accordance with the flight plan.
climb immediately to the cruising level indicated in the flight plan.

nR0mvX1e.question: What action is required by the pilot of an aircraft if unable to establish radio contact with an aeronautical station?

options.text: The aircraft shall attempt to establish communication with other aircraft or other aeronautical stations on frequencies appropriate to the route.
The aircraft shall squawk Code 7500 and land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
The pilot shall ensure that the radio equipment is functioning correctly and then make a test transmission on the appropriate frequency for the route being flown.
The aircraft shall squawk Code 7600 and proceed to its original destination in accordance with its filed flight plan.

wG0T8BPI.question:
When a controlled VFR flight transiting a Control Zone suffers a communications failure, what shall the pilot do?

1. Continue to fly in either VMC or IMC as meteorological conditions dictate.2. Continue to fly in VMC.3. Leave the Control Zone by the shortest route taking into account the weather conditions, obstacles and known areas of high traffic density4. Land as soon as possible at the nearest controlled aerodrome in the Control Zone, watching for visual signals when in the aerodrome traffic circuit.5. Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.6. Report the aircraft`s arrival by the most expeditious means to the appropriate ATS Unit.

ysLjEAk2.question: If an SSR transponder failure occurs after departure of an IFR flight, the pilot should..

options.text: inform the current ATC unit immediately.
land at the nearest suitable aerodrome for repair.
squawk 7600.
continue the flight in VMC.

h8OrDT6e.question: You are flying IFR in IMC conditions and experience a communication failure. You continue to the IAF of your destination according to the prescribed procedure. Within how many minutes of your ETA should you land?

options.text: 30 minutes
10 minutes
45 minutes
15 minutes

NInHQriF.question: Within the European Region, an aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR departure has to squawk **7600** and:

options.text: maintain the level last assigned by the ATC for a period of 7 minutes and then climb in accordance with the flight plan.
maintain the altitude last assigned by ATC for a period of 5 minutes and then continue in accordance with the flight plan.
climb immediately to the cruising level indicated in the flight plan.
land at the departure aerodrome in any case.

Fxavh1u7.question:
In the event of a communication failure, which of the following statements are correct?
1. Before transmitting blind, the aircraft station shall attempt to establish communication on the emergency frequency.  
2. After recognising the voice communications failure, the aircraft station shall attempt to establish contact on the previous channel used.  
3. An aircraft operating within a network shall monitor the appropriate VHF channel for calls from nearby aircraft.  
4. In case all other attempts fail to establish contact, the aircraft station shall make blind transmissions on the emergency frequency.

options.text: 2 and 3
2 and 4
1 and 4
1 and 3

oLpXbWaI.question: An aircraft on an IFR flight in VMC experiences radio communication failure. The aircraft is assumed to:

options.text: land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
land at the alternate aerodrome.
land at the destination aerodrome.
return to the aerodrome of departure.

g9dDpZbD.question: An aircraft is squawking 7600. What does it indicate?

options.text: It is unable to establish communication due to radio equipment failure.
It is about to make a forced landing.
It is requesting immediate level change.
It is diverting to the alternate aerodrome.

art7x1xM.question: What action is required by the pilot of an IFR flight if the aircraft is unable to establish radio contact with an aeronautical station?

options.text: The aircraft shall attempt to establish communication with other aircraft or other aeronautical stations on frequencies appropriate to the route.
The aircraft shall squawk Code 7600 and proceed to its original destination in accordance with its filed flight plan.
The aircraft shall squawk Code 7500 and land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
The pilot shall ensure that the radio equipment is functioning correctly and then make a test transmission on the appropriate frequency for the route being flown.

2cCyKJeB.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC and not expecting any approach delay must start descent over the designated navigational aid serving the destination aerodrome

options.text: at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) resulting from the Current Flight Plan (CPL).
at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) based on the Filed Flight Plan (FPO).
4 minutes after reaching the Initial Approach Fix (IAP).
immediately after reaching the navigation aid in any case.

85JGLXgh.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC and not expecting any approach delay must start descent over the designated navigational aid serving the destination aerodrome...

options.text: at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) resulting from the Current Flight Plan (CPL).
immediately after reaching the navigation aid in any case.
4 minutes after reaching the Initial Approach Fix (IAP).
at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) based on the Filed Flight Plan (FPO).

vlrLpapI.question: What is the transponder code for radio communication failure?

GPoWmbJg.question: What is the transponder code for radio communication failure?

EeOSnkzs.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC has to hold over the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome...

options.text: until the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.
for 3 minutes, if an expected approach time has not been acknowledged.
for 5 minutes in any case.
until 10 minutes after the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.

YWyEArUf.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC has to hold over the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome

options.text: until the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.
until 10 minutes after the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.
for 5 minutes in any case.
for 3 minutes, if an expected approach time has not been acknowledged.

s5P7ONS1.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC has to hold over the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome..

options.text: until the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.
for 3 minutes, if an expected approach time has not been acknowledged.
until 10 minutes after the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.
for 5 minutes in any case.

cytWfhFG.question: You have been cleared to FL100 in procedural airspace. However, your flight plan states FL310 as your planned cruising level. You are IMC. You attempt to call ATC for clearance to FL310, but there is no response. After squawking 7600 you should then...

options.text: remain at FL100 for 20 minutes and then proceed with the flight plan.
remain at FL100 for 7 minutes and then proceed with the flight plan.
remain at FL100 for 1 minute and then proceed with the flight plan.
continue to climb according to the flight plan.

ZHFgr0M9.question: ICAO has reserved a set of SSR codes for pilots to use in certain conditions. Which of the following is correct?

options.text: 7600 – Communication Failure.
7600 – Distress.
7700 – Unlawful Interference.
7500 – Communication Failure.

H2qenc4u.question: ICAO has reserved a set of SSR codes for pilots to use in certain conditions. Which of the following is correct?

options.text: 7600 - Communication Failure.
7500 - Communication Failure.
7600 - Distress.
7700 - Unlawful Interference.

E2mURjwq.question:
ICAO has reserved a set of SSR codes for pilots to use in certain conditions
Which of the following is correct?

options.text: 7600 -Communication Failure.
7700 – Unlawful Interference.
7600 – Distress.
7500 – Communication Failure.

Hm54slXS.question: An IFR flight encounters radio communication failure in VMC and the PIC considers that he/she will be able to continue to fly in VMC. He/she will..

options.text: land at the nearest suitable aerodrome, and report his/her arrival by the most expeditious means to the appropriate air traffic services unit.
land at destination aerodrome unless it is not accessible, and report his/her arrival by the most expeditious means to the appropriate rescue coordination centre.
land at the nearest suitable aerodrome, and report his/her arrival by the most expeditious means to the appropriate rescue coordination centre.
land at destination aerodrome unless it is not accessible, and report his/her arrival by the most expeditious means to the appropriate air traffic services unit.

C2jPBpEq.question: In case the pilot is experiencing communication failure in the aerodrome traffic circuit at a controlled aerodrome, he/she shall attempt to establish communications, using all other available means, with which ATC unit?

options.text: TWR
AIS
PAR
ACC
on the designated frequency (frequency in use).
on regional guard frequencies only.
to all available aeronautical stations.
during IFR flights only.

QlvUXtZa.question:
A pilot is flying in airspace where no Air Traffic Control service or advisory service is provided. Should the pilot suffer a receiver failure, apart from preceding all transmissions with "Transmitting blind due to receiver failure", which of the following actions must be taken?
1. Transmit reports at scheduled times2. Repeat each message after transmitting it3. Advise the time of the next intended transmission4. Transmit information regarding the pilot-in-command’s intention for continuation of the flight5. Set the appropriate SSR code6. Attempt to re-establish communications using the company frequency

BLN1yKF2.question: If two-way communication with Air Traffic Services is lost, the aircraft will be instructed to acknowledge by making a specified manoeuvre, or to make SSR code and/or ADS-B transmission changes. What other instructions could the aircraft receive to determine whether the receiver is functioning or not?

options.text: To operate IDENT.
To contact the Air Traffic Services unit by phone.
To operate altimeter reference changes.
To operate the aircraft lights.

QK49F1AH.question:
If two-way communication with Air Traffic Services is lost, the aircraft will be instructed to acknowledge by making a specified manoeuvre, or to make SSR code and/or ADS-B transmission changes
	What other instructions could the aircraft receive to determine whether the receiver is functioning or not?

options.text: To operate IDENT.
To operate the aircraft lights.
To operate altimeter reference changes.
To contact the Air Traffic Services unit by phone.

PrAEQUJU.question: An aircraft on an IFR flight in VMC experiences radio communication failure. The aircraft is assumed to..

options.text: continue to fly in visual meteorological conditions, and land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
continue to fly to its original destination in instrument or visual meteorological conditions.
continue to fly in visual meteorological conditions to its original destination or, if that is not possible, the alternate aerodrome.
continue to fly in visual meteorological conditions, and land at the original destination.

DR1dXicr.question: When approaching the destination aerodrome an aircraft experiences communication failure. What would be an appropriate course of action?

options.text: Join the traffic circuit to land and try to establish communication with ATC using all available means.
Proceed on the runway heading, level off at the minimum sector altitude and set the transponder code to 7500.
Set the transponder code to 7700 and proceed towards destination, in accordance with the flight plan.
Rock the aircraft wings and flash the navigational lights, at irregular intervals, to signal a communication failure.

Y5LykLAH.question: You are cleared to fly FL100 in an airspace where procedural separation is applied. However, your flight plan states FL310. You try to contact ATC to change flight level, but you do not get a response. After squawking 7600 you should:

options.text: Remain at FL100 for 20 minutes then proceed with flight plan.
Remain at FL100 for 7 minutes then proceed with flight plan.
Remain at FL100 for 1 minute then proceed with flight plan.
Continue to climb according to the flight plan.

cotzcjqX.question: The lost communication procedure for IFR flight operated in IMC requires the pilot to land, if possible, within a certain time around the estimated time of arrival of his current flight plan. What is this time?

options.text: 30 min
45 min
60 min
10 min

NquxmjBS.question: Immediately after take-off, an aircraft is experiencing communication failure. What would be an appropriate course of action?

options.text: Join the traffic circuit to land and try to establish communication with ATC using all available means.
Proceed on the runway heading, level off at the minimum sector altitude and set the transponder code to 7500.
Set the transponder code to 7700 and proceed towards destination, in accordance with the flight plan.
Rock the aircraft wings and flash the navigational lights, at irregular intervals, to signal a communication failure.

937KpMrR.question: What action is required by the pilot of an aircraft station if he/she is unable to establish radio contact with an aeronautical station?

options.text: Try to establish communication with other aircraft or aeronautical stations.
Squawk mode A code 7500.
Divert to the alternate airport.
Land at the nearest aerodrome appropriate to the route of flight.

mUrLVoTH.question: What action is required by the pilot of an aircraft station if he/she is unable to establish radio contact with an aeronautical station?

options.text: Try to establish communication with other aircraft or aeronautical stations
Squawk mode A code 7500
Land at the nearest aerodrome appropriate to the route of flight
Divert to the alternate airport

qk2NMuck.question: When transmitting a message preceded by the phrase 'Transmitting blind due to receiver failure' during an en-route flight, the aircraft station shall also

options.text: advise the time of its next intended transmission.
return to the airport of departure.
join base leg when approaching the airfield for landing.
land at the nearest airfield/airport.

uE6gQbkE.question: An air traffic controller observes an aircraft's SSR code to be 7600. This indicates...

options.text: loss of communication.
aircraft interception.
a hijacking.
an emergency.

JlotBlvZ.question: In the event that a pilot is required to make a 'BLIND' transmission, this should be made

options.text: twice on the designated frequency.
on the emergency frequency only.
only once on the designated frequency.
during VFR flights only.

9AYBlguG.question: When an aircraft fails to establish contact on the designated frequency, on which other frequency should the first attempt to re-establish communications be made?

options.text: On the previous frequency.
On the FIR search and rescue frequency.
On 121.5 MHz.
On the 243.0 MHz UHF emergency frequency.

QKbwFC9b.question: When an aircraft fails to establish contact on the designated frequency, on which other frequency should the first attempt to re-establish communications be made?

options.text: On the previous frequency used.
On 121.5 MHz.
On the FIR Search And Rescue frequency.
On the appropriate UHF emergency frequency.

lqGQUZeV.question: An aircraft encountering radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC has to land, if possible, within:

options.text: 30 minutes after ETA or the last EAT, whichever is later.
30 minutes after waiting for the EAT.
30 minutes after noticing the radio failure.
15 minutes after vacating the transition layer.
on the designated frequency (frequency in use).
on regional guard frequencies only.
during IFR flights only.
to all available aeronautical stations.

1n1bReKb.question: The lost communication procedure for IFR flights in IMC states that the pilot must land, if possible, within how many minutes of the estimated time of arrival of the current flight plan?

options.text: 30 minutes
10 minutes
45 minutes
60 minutes

1jqtfo4I.question: In the event that a pilot is required to make a blind transmission, this should be made..

options.text: twice on the designated frequency.
on the emergency frequency only.
only once on the designated frequency.
during VFR flights only.

edozJMEb.question: Under which of the following circumstances shall an aircraft station squawk 7600?

options.text: In case of radio communication failure.
When entering bad weather areas.
When flying over desert areas.
When approaching a prohibited area.

6sYDgfuz.question: You are flying in IMC under radar control, and you experience a communication failure. What should you do?

options.text: Set transponder 7600 and maintain the last assigned speed and flight level for 7 minutes.
Declare mayday and continue flying towards the last cleared waypoint.
Set transponder 7600 and maintain the last assigned flight level and heading for 7 minutes.
Continue flying towards your next waypoint and hold over for troubleshooting.

ySmBc4MP.question: A controlled VFR flight is transiting a control zone and suffers a communication failure. The correct actions are: - Continue in VMC or IMC, depending on the meteorological conditions. - Continue in VMC - Leave the control zone on the shortest way by taking into account weather, obstacles and areas of high traffic density. - Land as soon as possible at the nearest controlled aerodrome in the control zone and watch out for visual signals when flying in the traffic pattern. - Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome. - Report the aircraft's arrival by the most expeditous means to the appropriate ATC unit.

5Iquqkm4.question: When an aircraft station is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure, what procedure should be taken?

options.text: Transmit reports at scheduled times or positions, preceded by the phrase “Transmitting blind due to receiver failure”
Change to frequency 121.5 MHZ and squawk 7700.
Land at the nearest uncontrolled airfield.
Transmit at regular times or positions, the phrase “Transmitting blind due to receiver failure”

m6xi9dCu.question: When an aircraft station is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure, what procedure should be taken?

options.text: Transmit reports at scheduled times or positions, preceded by the phrase “Transmitting blind due to receiver failure”.
Change to frequency 121.5 MHZ and squawk 7700.
Land at the nearest uncontrolled airfield.
Transmit at regular times or positions, the phrase “Transmitting blind due to receiver failure”.

ZoIM9PiA.question: In case of communications failure while flying VFR, the pilot: - is allowed to fly VFR in IMC. - might be allowed to enter a control zone under specific circumstances. - shall squawk **7600.**

options.text: 3 only

hotpbCKL.question: If an SSR transponder failure occurs after departure of an IFR flight, the pilot should

options.text: inform the current ATC unit immediately.
land at the nearest suitable aerodrome for repair.
squawk 7600.
continue the flight in VMC.

mT1vxWUb.question: A pilot is flying under the IFR rules in VMC conditions when you experience communication failure. What actions should the pilot take?

options.text: Continue in VMC, land at the nearest suitable aerodrome and report your arrival to the appropriate air traffic control unit.
Continue to the destination aerodrome, adding 500 ft to all the altitudes in the flight plan.
Squawk 7700 and continue in accordance with the flight plan.
Continue in VMC to the destination aerodrome and land within 30 min after the estimated time of arrival in the flight plan.

HAMYHHiR.question: An aircraft flying under IFR in VMC experiences communication failure. Can the aircraft complete the IFR flight?

options.text: Yes, if the PIC considers it inadvisable to continue in VMC.
No, the flight must return to the departure aerodrome in VMC.
It is mandatory to continue the flight in IFR.
No, the flight must continue in VMC.

rj3linVV.question: Two aircraft are experiencing a radio communication failure. Aeroplane A is in the downwind leg of a controlled aerodrome, aeroplane B is en-route, cruising at FL055. Select the correct statement from the options below.

options.text: Aeroplane A has to watch out for visual signals.
Both aeroplanes need to sqawk 7700 and make blind transmissions on 121.5 MHz.
Aeroplane A need not notify ATC upon arrival because he is landing at a controlled aerodrome; however, a report has to be made to the aerodrome of departure.
ICAO communication failure procedures take priority over any local regulations.

ULkeCGzW.question: Two aircraft are experiencing a radio communication failure. Aeroplane A is in the downwind leg of a controlled aerodrome, aeroplane B is en-route, cruising at FL055. Select the correct statement from the options below.

options.text: Aeroplane A has to watch out for visual signals.
Aeroplane A need not notify ATC upon arrival because he is landing at a controlled aerodrome; however, a report has to be made to the aerodrome of departure.
ICAO communication failure procedures take priority over any local regulations.
Both aeroplanes need to sqawk 7700 and make blind transmissions on 121.5 MHz.

oMPqrcwg.question: Which ATS unit will you try to contact if you are in the traffic circuit and experience a communications failure?

options.text: Tower
Radar
Approach
Ground

GDbLx3GH.question:
An aircraft station fails to establish radio contact with an aeronautical station on the designated frequency
What action is required by the pilot?

options.text: Attempt to establish contact with the station on an alternative frequency.
Continue the flight to the destination airport without any communication.
Land at the nearest airport without an ATC unit.
Return to the airport of departure.

VUUq7hQC.question: When transmitting a message preceded by the phrase 'Transmitting blind due to receiver failure' during an en-route flight, the aircraft station shall also:

options.text: Advise the time of its next intended transmission
Return to the airport of departure
and at the nearest airfield/airport
Join base leg when approaching the airfield for landing

qkg8ytgu.question: An aircraft departing on a SID in European airspace which experiences total radio failure should:

options.text: Maintain cleared level for 7 minutes then climb in accordance with flight plan.
Climb immediately to cleared flight plan level.
Maintain cleared level for 5 minutes then climb in accordance with flight plan.
Return and land at departure airfield.

eYHAqOim.question: The expression "TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE" implies that no answer is expected. It shall be used by:

options.text: an aircraft station being aware of receiver failure.
an aircraft station doing blind transmissions at a "non-towered" airfield.
a radar controller performing a PAR or SRE final approach.
a ground station broadcasting information to all listening stations.

4wPCBP67.question: A departing aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight under radar vectors is to squawk 7600 and...

options.text: proceed to the route indicated in the current flight plan in the most direct manner.
maintain the heading last assigned by ATC for a period of 3 minutes and then return to the flight path in accordance with the current flight plan.
maintain present heading for 1 minute and thereafter return to the route indicated in the current flight plan on the shortest way.
regardless of any limitation previously instructed by ATC, return to the route indicated in the current flight plan in the most direct manner.

b01kLv7y.question:
In case of radio communication failure, which of the following statements is/are correct?

1. A VFR flight can fly in Instrument Meteorological Conditions, as an exception.2. A VFR flight may, under certain circumstances, enter the relevant control zones.3. A VFR flight shall squawk 7600.

options.text: 2 and 3
1 and 3

Z2gnwr7l.question: On an IFR flight two-way communication is lost as the aircraft is holding above the final destination. The expected approach time (EAT) was passed as **1420** UTC before communication was lost. The aircraft should squawk **7600** and make an approach to land at:

options.text: not before the EAT and no later than 30 minutes after ETA.
the EAT, plus or minus 10 minutes.
not before the EAT and no later than 20 minutes after ETA.
not before the EAT and no later than 10 minutes after ETA.

9H8MaaDR.question:
An aircraft on an IFR flight in IMC conditions, and flying in airspace where procedural separation is being applied, experiences radio communication failure
When passing over a compulsory reporting point, what action should the PIC take?

options.text: Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
Maintain last assigned level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, turn right by 30 degrees and parallel to the flight plan route with a 5 NM offset, until reaching the destination aerodrome.
Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
Maintain last assigned speed and initiate a 300 ft per minute climb until reaching VMC conditions, then divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.

rP6EcXU3.question: An aircraft on an IFR flight in IMC conditions, and flying in airspace where procedural separation is being applied, experiences radio communication failure. When passing over a compulsory reporting point, what action should the PIC take?

options.text: Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
Maintain last assigned speed and initiate a 300 ft per minute climb until reaching VMC conditions, then divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.
Maintain last assigned level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, turn right by 30 degrees and parallel to the flight plan route with a 5 NM offset, until reaching the destination aerodrome.

0WdKmKYa.question:
An aircraft on an IFR flight in IMC conditions, and flying in airspace where procedural separation is being applied, experiences radio communication failure. 
When passing over a compulsory reporting point, what action should the PIC take?

options.text: Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
Maintain last assigned speed and initiate a 300 ft per minute climb until reaching VMC conditions, then divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.

Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, turn right by 30 degrees and parallel to the flight plan route with a 5nm offset, until reaching the destination aerodrome.
Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.

9ROwIk3g.question:
Following a radio failure, the pilot tries to re-establish communications. All transmissions are preceded with "Transmitting blind." What must the pilot do after this phrase?
1. Set the SSR code to 75002. Repeat the message twice on the designated channel-s3. Include the name of the station being addressed4. Deviate from the assigned route by at least 45°

options.text: 2 and 3
1 and 2
1 and 4
3 and 4

tBtkKJ6o.question: An aircraft on an IFR flight in IMC conditions, and flying in airspace where procedural separation is being applied, experiences radio communication failure. When passing over a compulsory reporting point, what action should the PIC take??

options.text: Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
Maintain last assigned level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, turn right by 30 degrees and parallel to the flight plan route with a 5 NM offset, until reaching the destination aerodrome.
Maintain last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
Maintain last assigned speed and initiate a 300 ft per minute climb until reaching VMC conditions, then divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.

xbQruGO8.question: The expression 'transmitting blind due to receiver failure' implies that no answer is expected is used by

options.text: an aircraft aware of receiver failure.
an aircraft transmitting blind at a non-towered airfield.
a radar controller performing a PAR (Precision Approach Radar)or SRE (Surveillance Radar Equipment)final approach.
aground station broadcasting information to all listening stations.

gBrWI6wC.question: If all attempts to establish radio contact with a ground station fail, the pilot of an aeroplane shall transmit messages preceded by the phrase..

options.text: Transmitting blind
PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN
How do you read?
Read you one, read you one

IQuDV0zF.question: When transmitting a message preceded by the phrase "TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE" during an en-route flight, the aircraft station shall also:

options.text: advise the time of its next intended transmission.
join base leg when approaching the airfield for landing.
land at the nearest airfield/airport.
return to the airport of departure.

6YELFQnr.question: An aircraft encountering radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC has to commence descent over the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome (no EAT received):

options.text: at, or as close to, the ETA resulting from the current flight plan.
5 minutes after the last expected approach time acknowledged.
after 3 minutes, if an expected approach time is not acknowledged.
immediately after reaching in any case.

85GJv71m.question: An air traffic controller observes an aircraft`s SSR code to be 7600This indicates

options.text: loss of communication.
a hijacking.
aircraft interception.
an emergency.

6s84B5Oy.question: An air traffic controller observes an aircraft`s SSR code to be 7600. This indicates..

options.text: loss of communication.
a hijacking.
aircraft interception.
an emergency.

mc1uLwTt.question: The expression "transmitting blind due to receiver failure" implies that no answer is expected. It is used by..

options.text: an aircraft aware of receiver failure.
a radar controller performing a PAR (Precision Approach Radar)or SRE (Surveillance Radar Equipment)final approach.
an aircraft transmitting blind at a non-towered airfield.
aground station broadcasting information to all listening stations.

44p1bLq3.question: When an aircraft is unable to establish communication due to airborne equipment failure it shall, when so equipped, squawk..

AKM40T8N.question: An aircraft encountering radio communication failure on an IFR flight in VMC is assumed to:

options.text: complete to fly IFR flight according to the flight plan until reaching the destination, if advisable.
continue to fly in VMC, land at the destination aerodrome, report its arrival.
continue to fly in VMC, land at the alternate aerodrome, report its arrival.
continue to fly in VMC, land at the departure aerodrome, report its arrival.

X8JxsmaC.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC is assumed to:

options.text: proceed in accordance with the current flight plan to the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome.
divert to the most suitable aerodrome according to the route of flight.
proceed to an area from where the flight can be continued according to the visual flight rules.
execute a VMC approach at the nearest suitable aerodrome.

1KUKTiPL.question: A pilot has set the transponder code to 7600. This indicates..

options.text: radio failure.
distress.
loss of position.
unlawful interference.

8HAOXNCn.question: You are flying under IFR in an airspace where radar is used in the provision of air traffic control. You are experiencing receiver failure. The last communication you received was a level assignment. After reaching this level, you should maintain it for a period of how many minutes?

BUIIv2WJ.question: If the transponder fails before the departure for an IFR flight, the pilot must...

options.text: obtain prior permission from ATC to conduct the flight.
inform FIS for relay to the relevant ATC unit.
insert under item 18 of the flight plan transponder unserviceable.
inform ATC after departure.

z7NMFcjO.question: A pilot is flying in an airspace where no ATC service or advisory service is provided. Should the pilot suffer a receiver failure, apart from preceding all transmissions with “Transmitting blind due to receiver failure”, which of the following actions must be taken? - Transmit reports at scheduled times. - Repeat each message after transmitting it. - Advise the time of the next intended transmission. - Transmit information regarding the pilot in command’s intention for continuation of the flight. - Set the appropriate SSR code. - Attempt to re-establish communications using the company frequency.

QIUcRBHJ.question: What can be omitted in a blind transmission due to receiver failure communication?

options.text: The frequency of the station called if a frequency change is not intended.
The repetition of the full message.
The phrase "Transmitting blind due to receiver failure".
The time of the next intended transmission.

n4UGC3EH.question: Having lost two way communications with ATC you have been instructed to acknowledge with changes in direction, changes in SSR and ADS-B. What other method could be used?

options.text: Squawk Ident.
Altimeter changes.
Flashing lights.
Contact by telephone.

IsuWKhd1.question: A departing aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight under radar vectors has to:

options.text: squawk 7600 and thereafter return to the route indicated in the current flight plan in the most direct manner.
squawk 7600 and thereafter, regardless of any limitation instructed by ATC, return to the route indicated in the current flight plan on the shortest way.
squawk 7600, maintain present heading for 7 minutes and thereafter return to the route indicated in the current flight plan on the shortest way.
squawk 7600 and maintain the heading last assigned by ATC for a period of 7 minutes and then return to the flight path in accordance with the current flight plan.

TE8mFAuq.question: A message preceded by the phrase "TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE RECEIVER FAILURE" shall be transmitted:

options.text: on the frequency presently in use.
on all available aeronautical stations.
on the international emergency frequency.
on the regional guard frequency.

qLG5tW6v.question: If an aircraft is unable to establish two-way communication due to a receiver malfunction, all but one of the following items shall be transmitted. Which item can be excluded?

options.text: The frequency on which a transmission is made.
The time of the next planned transmission.
The phrase “transmitting blind due to receiver failure”.
A complete repetition of the transmitted message.

30DHeBs3.question:
Should a pilot lose communication during a flight, which are the correct ways of trying to re-establish air-ground communication?

1. Use the company ground frequency2. Contact other aircraft3. Use the previous frequency4. Use the pilot-to-pilot frequency5. Use another frequency appropriate to the route.6. Contact other aeronautical stations7. Use the designated standby frequency

FizStb9C.question: If an SSR transponder failure occurs after departure of an IFR flight, the pilot should...

options.text: inform the current ATC unit immediately.
land at the nearest suitable aerodrome for repair.
squawk 7600.
continue the flight in VMC.

wSonRST7.question: When an aircraft is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure, it shall transmit reports and the time of its next intended transmission on the frequency in use. Each transmission has to be preceded by the phrase...

options.text: TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE.
PAN PAN.
UNABLE TO RECEIVE.
NO RECEPTION TRANSMISSION.

AOa7a5jU.question:
When an aircraft is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure, it shall transmit reports and the time of its next intended transmission on the frequency in use.
	Each transmission has to be preceded by the phrase

options.text: TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE
NO RECEPTION TRANSMISSION
PAN PAN
UNABLE TO RECEIVE

WXfiLFzx.question: When an aircraft is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure, it shall transmit reports and the time of its next intended transmission on the frequency in use. Each transmission has to be preceded by the phrase..

options.text: TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE
NO RECEPTION TRANSMISSION
UNABLE TO RECEIVE
PAN PAN

ibbnH7zB.question:
Here is an extract of an exchange of radio-communication between the pilot of F-GTPO and Lille Tower: "F-PO, squawk 6101." "6101, F-PO." "F-PO, radar identified, cleared to Lille via route SA then leave controlled airspace via route N." "Cleared to Lille via route SA then leave controlled airspace via route N, F-PO." After a short while, F-PO is entering controlled airspace. "F-PO, Lille Tower, radio check 118.550." No answer. "F-PO, Lille Tower, if you read me, squawk IDENT." No answer but the controller`s radar shows that IDENT has been operated.

Assume that specific procedures for communication failure procedures have NOT been established for Lille Tower.

Which of the following statements are correct?
1. F-PO shall exit controlled airspace as soon as possible because he/she has a communication failure.2. F-PO is a controlled flight and must continue its transit to follow its clearance, unless this is incompatible with the regulation applicable for communication failure.3. F-PO will NOT receive any instruction from Lille Tower that will alter its transit clearance, other traffic will be instructed away from F-PO to maintain separation as applicable.4. F-PO may receive additional instructions from Lille Tower and the clearances can be acknowledged by operating the transponder.

options.text: 2 and 4
1 and 4
1 and 3
2 and 3

GGw6AMvF.question: In the event that a pilot is required to make a blind transmission, this should be made

options.text: twice on the designated frequency.
only once on the designated frequency.
during VFR flights only.
on the emergency frequency only.

7OzvUlBX.question: In the event that a pilot is required to make a blind transmission, this should be made...

options.text: twice on the designated frequency.
during VFR flights only.
on the emergency frequency only.
only once on the designated frequency.

twvGSOOT.question: When an aircraft is unable to establish communication due to airborne equipment failure it shall, when so equipped, squawk

eHV9NONw.question: When an aircraft is unable to establish communication due to airborne equipment failure it shall, when so equipped, squawk...

Ti3Z6dWG.question: A departing aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight under radar vectors is to squawk 7600 and

options.text: proceed to the route indicated in the current flight plan in the most direct manner.
regardless of any limitation previously instructed by ATC, return to the route indicated in the current flight plan in the most direct manner.
maintain the heading last assigned by ATC for a period of 3 minutes and then return to the flight path in accordance with the current flight plan.
maintain present heading for 1 minute and thereafter return to the route indicated in the current flight plan on the shortest way.

CZdAm8Jd.question: An aircraft encountering radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC has to land, if possible, within..

options.text: 30 minutes after ETA or the last EAT, whichever is later.
30 minutes after waiting for the EAT.
30 minutes after noticing the radio failure.
15 minutes after vacating the transition layer.

shWjbcLd.question: An aircraft forming part of the aerodrome traffic at a controlled aerodrome experiences a loss of radio communication. Amongst other requirements, the aircraft shall...

options.text: Look out for instructions that may be issued by visual signals.
Land without delay, vacate the runway and report the termination of the flight.
Look out for instructions that may be issued by other aircraft of the aerodrome traffic.
Exit the aerodrome traffic and divert to the next suitable aerodrome.

SXOWTJ1K.question: Within the European Region, an aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR departure has to squawk 7600 and

options.text: maintain the level last assigned by ATC for a period of 7 minutes and then climb in accordance with the flight plan.
climb immediately to the cruising level indicated in the flight plan.
maintain the level last assigned by ATC for a period of 5 minutes and then continue in accordance with the flight plan.
land at the departure aerodrome.

OyyKXt3U.question: Should an aircraft’s radios fail in IMC whilst conducting an IFR flight, the pilots must descent in order to perform an instrument approach?

options.text: At the designated navigational aid or fix.
Any time when flying in the ATZ.
At the current EAT.
At the calculated TOD point.

dUE0Zh9x.question: The expression transmitting blind due to receiver failure implies that no answer is expected. It is used by...

options.text: an aircraft aware of receiver failure.
aground station broadcasting information to all listening stations.
an aircraft transmitting blind at a non-towered airfield.
a radar controller performing a PAR -Precision Approach Radar-or SRE -Surveillance Radar Equipment-final approach.

cgk7OxKs.question: An IFR flight in IMC conditions is being radar vectored when the aircraft experiences radio communication failure. Taking into consideration the applicable minimum flight altitude, the PIC should..

options.text: proceed in the most direct manner possible to rejoin the flight plan route no later than the next significant point.
climb to the Minimum Sector Altitude and hold for a period of 7 minutes, and then rejoin the flight plan route.
maintain the last assigned heading for a period of 7 minutes, and then adjust in accordance with the flight plan.
maintain the last assigned heading for a period of 20 minutes, and then adjust in accordance with the flight plan.

zZBnoz5b.question: An IFR flight in IMC conditions is being radar vectored when the aircraft experiences radio communication failure. Taking into consideration the applicable minimum flight altitude, the PIC should...

options.text: proceed in the most direct manner possible to rejoin the flight plan route no later than the next significant point.
maintain the last assigned heading for a period of 20 minutes, and then adjust in accordance with the flight plan.
climb to the Minimum Sector Altitude and hold for a period of 7 minutes, and then rejoin the flight plan route.
maintain the last assigned heading for a period of 7 minutes, and then adjust in accordance with the flight plan.

FFh2kUeN.question: After it has experienced a loss of radio communication in VMC, an aircraft on an IFR flight lands successfully at the nearest suitable aerodrome. What shall it do next?

options.text: Report the arrival to the appropriate ATC unit by the most expeditious means.
Report the arrival time to the ATC or the failure to the aerodrome operator.
Inform the appropriate CAA and organise repair of the failed radio as quickly as possible.
Organise repair of its failed equipment by an authorised avionics repair organisation within 30 days.

ueyMOypj.question: You are in the traffic pattern of a controlled airport and you notice a radio failure. Which of the following is correct? - If you see a flashing red light, it means that the airport is unsafe and you do not land. - You try to establish communication with the ATS unit with all the possible means available. - If you see a flashing green light you approach to land.

L2zYrcJB.question: A message preceded by the phrase “transmitting blind due to receiver failure” shall be transmitted...

options.text: on the frequency in use at the time.
to all available aeronautical stations.
on the international emergency frequency.
on the regional guard frequency.

ziINK2ON.question: Two aircraft are experiencing communication failure. Aircraft A is on a VFR flight on the downwind leg to land at a controlled aerodrome. Aircraft B is also on a VFR flight cruising atFL55. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A watch shall be kept by the pilot of aircraft A as instructions may be issued by visual signals.
The arrival report can be omitted by the pilot of aircraft A, as there is an ATC unit at the aerodrome, but one must still be filed at the aerodrome reporting office at the aerodrome of departure.
For both aircraft, the general communication failure procedures of the ICAO “Rules of the Air” override any published local procedures.
If aircraft B is a VFR flight above the clouds, it may descend through the clouds to land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
on the designated frequency  in use.
on regional guard frequencies only.
to all available aeronautical stations.
during IFR flights only.

yE4Ywupf.question: In case the transponder fails before the departure for an IFR flight, the pilot shall:

options.text: obtain prior permission by ATC to conduct the flight.
inform FIS for relay to AIS.
cancel flight.
insert under item 18 of the flight plan TRANSPONDER UNSERVICABLE and inform ATC after departure.

ilsN1Ejx.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC should

options.text: proceed in accordance with the current flight plan to the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome.
divert to the most suitable aerodrome according to the route of flight.
proceed to an area from where the flight can be continued according to the visual flight rules.
execute a VMC approach at the nearest suitable aerodrome.

gzPjKkR4.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in VMC should

options.text: land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
land at the alternate aerodrome.
land at the destination aerodrome.
return to the aerodrome of departure.

A2fSl70s.question:
Refer to the following extract of an exchange of radio-communication between pilot (F-GTPO) and Lille Tower:
  • ATC: "F-PO, squawk **6151**." - Pilot: "6151, F-PO." - ATC: "F-PO, radar identified, cleared to Lille via route SA then leave controlled airspace via route N." - Pilot: "Cleared to Lille via route SA then leave controlled airspace via route N, F-PO."
After a short while, F-PO is entering controlled airspace.
  • ATC: "F-PO, Lille Tower, radio check 118.550."
No answer.
  • ATC: "F-PO, Lille Tower, if you read me, squawk IDENT."
No answer but the controller's radar shows that IDENT has been operated. Which of the following statements are correct if specific procedures for communication failure procedures have not been established for Lille Tower? - F-PO shall exit controlled airspace as soon as possible because of the communication failure. - F-PO is a controlled flight and must continue its transit to follow its clearance, unless this is incompatible with the regulation application for communication failure. - F-PO will not receive any instruction from Lille Tower that will alter its transit clearance, other traffic will be instructed away from F-PO to maintain separation as applicable. - F-PO may receive additional instructions from Lille Tower and the clearances can be acknowledged by operating the transponder.

dmBWEhvr.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC and not expecting any approach delay must start descent over the designated navigational aid serving the destination aerodrome..

options.text: at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) resulting from the Current Flight Plan (CPL).
immediately after reaching the navigation aid in any case.
at or as close as possible to the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) based on the Filed Flight Plan (FPO).
4 minutes after reaching the Initial Approach Fix (IAP).

irF4nQJU.question: If the transponder fails before the departure for an IFR flight, the pilot must..

options.text: obtain prior permission from ATC to conduct the flight.
inform FIS for relay to the relevant ATC unit.
inform ATC after departure.
insert under item 18 of the flight plan “transponder unserviceable”.

LHPiRISq.question: You are approaching to land and are experiencing communications receiver failure. You decide to continue the flight as planned, with an approach on RWY27. Next in your flight plan is a descent from 6 000 ft to 2 000 ft. You head to transmit blind your report to ATC, followed by a complete repetition. The phraseology you will use is:

options.text: NEXT REPORT FINAL RWY 27, CONTINUING FLIGHT AS PLANNED.
HEADING 270, CONTINUING FLIGHT AS PER FLIGHT PLAN.
NEXT REPORT FINAL RWY 27, ALL STATIONS RECEIVING RADIO CHECK.
NEXT REPORT AT TIME 1201, ALL STATIONS RECEIVING RADIO CHECK.

YqupU1zM.question: An aircraft has suffered a radio receiver failure. Which of the following is not required in the "Transmitting Blind" message?

options.text: "Transmitting twice".
"Frequency in use".
"Time of next transmission".
"Transmitting blind ".

fx70Lh2l.question:
A pilot is flying VFR in controlled airspace when he/she notices a receiver failure
	Which of the following actions must the pilot take? 
1 Squawk 7500 and IDENT
2 Transmit reports at the scheduled times or positions
3 Precede the transmitted reports with the phrase 'TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE'
4 Transmit the reports on the frequency in use
5 Duplicate the reports on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz 
6 Exit the controlled airspace as soon as practicable.

options.text: 1 and 6

UHsktBXj.question: A pilot is flying through an airspace where no ATC service or advisory service is provided. If the pilot suffered a receiver failure, which of the following actions should be taken, apart from preceding all transmissions with “Transmitting blind due to receiver failure”? - Transmit reports at scheduled times - Repeat every message after transmission - Advise the time of his next planned transmission - Pass on information about the pilot in command’s intentions for flight continuation - Set the appropriate code on the SSR transponder - Attempt to re-establish communication on the company frequency

iwX1qsgX.question: After suffering a radio receiver failure the pilots should make blind transmissions preceded by the phrase “TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE” and subsequently:

options.text: advise the time of the next intended transmission.
proceed to the pre-planned alternate.
enter the next enroute holding pattern encountered.
hold for 5 minutes.

ttxVoHNA.question:
A pilot is flying VFR in controlled airspace when he/she notices a receiver failure. Which of the following actions must the pilot take?

1. Squawk 7500 and IDENT.2. Transmit reports at the scheduled times or positions.3. Precede the transmitted reports with the phrase "TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE".4. Transmit the reports on the frequency in use.5. Duplicate the reports on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz.6. Exit the controlled airspace as soon as practicable.

options.text: 1 and 6

yyW71b36.question: On an IFR flight in IMC conditions, you suspect a comms equipment failure. What actions should you take?(1) Make two blind transmissions on the frequency in use stating your intentions.(2) Divert from your current track by 45 degrees for x minutes, and return to track according to flight plan.(3) Land at the nearest suitable airfield.(4) Continue to destination as per flight plan and commence an approach as close as possible to last EAT.

options.text: 1 and 4.
1 and 3
2 and 3
2 and 4

LZbWhxp6.question: Under which of the following circumstances shall an aircraft station squawk **7600**?

options.text: In case of radio communication failure.
When flying over desert areas.
When approaching a prohibited area.
When entering bad weather areas.

2CgLH19P.question: An aircraft is on an IFR flight in IMC and flies through an airspace where procedural separation is applied, when it suffers a loss of radio communication. What should the pilot in command do when passing over a compulsory reporting point?

options.text: Maintain the last assigned speed and flight level or the minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter, he/she shall adjust the speed and flight level according to the last approved flight plan.

Maintain his last assigned speed and flight level or the minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter, he/she shall adjust the speed and flight level according to the last approved flight plan.

Maintain the last assigned flight level or the minimum flight altitude if higher, turn right by 30° and continue parallel to the planned route with a 5 NM offset until reaching the planned destination aerodrome.
Maintain the last assigned speed and initiate a climb of 300 ft/min until reaching VMC. Then, he/she shall divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.

AwaoW5Po.question: An aircraft has suffered a radio receiver failure. Which of the following is not required in the 'Transmitting Blind' message?

options.text: frequency in use
The message to be transmitted
Time of next transmission.
Transmitting twice.

tHzw8ARU.question: You are on an IFR flight and just reach the TOC (top of climb). What are you going to do if you encounter a total loss of communication in VMC?

options.text: Continue the flight in VMC and fly to the next suitable aerodrome. Report your arrival to the appropriate ATS unit as soon as possible.
Continue the flight according to the planned route. Enter the holding at the initial approach fix and hold until the estimated approach time. Thereafter you can start the approach to land.
Continue the flight in VMC and fly to the destination. Report your arrival to the appropriate ATS as soon as possible.
Continue the flight in VMC or in IMC and fly to the next airfield which provides radar services.

UQIQaxsg.question: During flight, the flight crew hears a click on the ATC frequency but no voice. Nevertheless the frequency is blocked. What is most likely the reason?

options.text: The carrier wave is received but is not modulated.
The aircraft communications equipment has failed.
An interference with another station calling has occurred.
The modulating wave is received but the carrier wave is missing.

FCYWNqI5.question: If the transponder fails before the departure for an IFR flight, the pilot must

options.text: obtain prior permission from ATC to conduct the flight.
inform FIS for relay to the relevant ATC unit.
inform ATC after departure.
insert under item 18 of the flight plan “transponder unserviceable”

sZ8ebUXr.question: An aircraft under radar, flying IFR in IMC, is cleared to a new altitude. Just after reaching the cleared altitude, 8 NM before the next compulsory reporting point, it is unable to establish two way communication again. The pilot immediately sets the transponder code **7600**. Considering the order of events, the pilot should remain at the cleared altitude...

options.text: for 7 minutes after the compulsory reporting point.
for 12 minutes after reaching the compulsory reporting point.
for 7 minutes after setting transponder code 7600.
for 20 minutes after first noting the communications failure.

7uqY6eJW.question:
During an IFR flight in IMC conditions, the pilot suspects a comms equipment failure. What actions should he/she take?(1) Make two blind transmissions on the frequency in use stating your intentions. 
 (2) Divert from your current track by 45 degrees for x minutes, and return to track according to flight plan. 
 (3) Land at the nearest suitable airfield. 
 (4) Continue to destination as per flight plan and commence an approach as close as possible to last EAT.

options.text: 1 and 4.
1 and 3.
2 and 3.
2 and 4.

2Ldrll8S.question: The lost communication procedure for IFR flights in IMC states that the pilot must land, if possible, within how many minutes of the estimated time of arrival of the current flight plan?

options.text: 30 minutes
45 minutes
10 minutes
60 minutes

nd6mx41H.question: During radio communication failure, an aircraft forming part of the aerodrome traffic at a controlled aerodrome, shall amongst other requirements..

options.text: keep a watch for such instructions as may be issued by visual signals.
watch such instructions as may be issued by other aircraft of the aerodrome traffic.
leave the aerodrome traffic and divert to the next suitable aerodrome.
land without delay and vacate the runway and report the termination of the flight.

fUdAuiEH.question: What does the term blind transmission mean?

options.text: A transmission from one station to another station in circumstances where two-way communication cannot be established but it is believed that the called station is able to receive the transmission.
A transmission of information relating to air navigation that is not addressed to a specific station or stations.
A transmission where no reply is required from the receiving station.
A transmission of messages relating to en-route weather information which may affect the safety of aircraft operations that is not addressed to a specific station or stations.

A6s3QDCA.question: An aircraft experiences radio-communication failure in IMC. When is it expected to commence the descent from the navigation aid or fix for the instrument approach?

options.text: At the expected approach time last received and acknowledged.
Immediately after reaching the designated aerodrome navigation aid or fix.
After completing one hold over the designated aerodrome navigation aid or fix.
When the fuel on board is the final reserve fuel plus sufficient to fly for15 minutes.

m2PPiYuA.question: When an aircraft station is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure, the following procedure should be undertaken:

options.text: transmit reports at scheduled times or positions, preceded by the phrase "TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE".
change to frequency 121.5 MHZ and squawk 7700.
land at the nearest uncontrolled airfield.
transmit at regular times or positions, the phrase "TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE".

S7OfUm8L.question: You are flying in IMC under radar control, and you experience a communication failure. You squawk **7600** and maintain the last assigned speed and level for...

options.text: 7 minutes.
5 minutes.
20 minutes.
15 minutes.

cfRQIjyA.question: An aircraft during an IFR flight in IMC encounters a radio failure. The pilots must descent to perform an instrument approach...

options.text: at the designated navigation aid or navigation fix.
at the calculated TOD point.
at the current EAT.
any time when flying in the ATZ.

7hWFgvcd.question: You are tuning in a new frequency as assigned by ATC. After making multiple calls there is no reply and you notice the frequency is silent. What should you do next?

options.text: Attempt to establish contact on the previous frequency.
Transmit on the international guard frequency.
Declare a state of Urgency.
Attempt to contact other traffic on the current frequency.

EvW6s5Ce.question: When an aircraft flying IFR in IMC encounters a radio communication failure, and it is being vectored or has been directed by ATC to proceed offset using RNAV without a specified limit, it shall proceed in the most direct manner possible to rejoin the current flight plan route, taking into consideration the applicable minimum flight altitude...

options.text: no later than the next significant point.
at the final approach fix.
at the designated navigational aid.
at the initial approach fix.

ey7ggsRr.question: You are flying IFR in IMC. While you are on radar vectors, you suffer a communication failure. After resetting your transponder to **7600**, what will be the correct action?

options.text: Rejoin your current flight plan not later than next significant point.
Hold your heading for 7 minutes.
Turn towards the next suitable aerodrome for landing.
Hold your altitude for 7 minutes.

d2Qy0hAT.question: A message preceded by the phrase ?transmitting blind due to receiver failure' shall be transmitted?

options.text: on the frequency in use at the time.
on the international emergency frequency.
to all available aeronautical stations.
on the regional guard frequency.

IyJkISs0.question:
You have received the following take-off clearance: "YR-BTO, CLIMB STRAIGHT AHEAD UNTIL 4000 FT, BEFORE TURNING RIGHT HEADING 270, REPORT RIGHT TURN. RUNWAY 09 CLEARED FOR TAKE-OFF." 
After take-off you are experiencing communications receiver failure and need to transmit blind your report to ATC, followed by a complete repetition. What phraseology will you use? "YR-BTO, TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE...

options.text: ...RIGHT TURN HEADING 270 MAINTAINING 4000 FT. CONTINUING VFR FOR LANDING RWY 09."
...RIGHT TURN MAINTAINING 4000 FT. NEXT REPORT AT TIME 1201. ALL STATIONS RADIO CHECK."
...RIGHT TURN. CONTINUING VFR FOR LANDING RWY 09. NEXT REPORT FINAL."
...RIGHT TURN HEADING 270 SPEED 160 KNOTS. CONTINUING VFR FOR LANDING RWY 09."
on the designated frequency (frequency in use).
to all available aeronautical stations.
on regional guard frequencies only.
during IFR flights only.

eZrHCx8p.question: After reaching a reporting point while under radar control, you contact ATC to request a new flight level but cannot establish communications. What should you do?

options.text: Stay on the previous flight level for 7 minutes, then proceed with the filed flight plan.
Land at the nearest aerodrome.
Stay at previous flight level for 20 minutes, then proceed with flight plan.
Proceed directly to new flight level, continue trying to contact ATC or start blind transmissions.

gmVMQDeg.question: If an aircraft experiences a radio failure, the transponder should be set to:

3BMgulPG.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC is assumed to

options.text: proceed in accordance with the current flight plan to the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome.
execute a VMC approach at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
proceed to an area from where the flight can be continued according to the visual flight rules.
divert to the most suitable aerodrome according to the route of flight.

3ACmVxc6.question: An aircraft is squawking **7600**. This indicates:

options.text: It is unable to establish communication due to radio equipment failure.
It is requesting immediate level change.
It is diverting to the alternate aerodrome.
It is about to make a forced landing.

oWrLoFDX.question: In the event of a communication failure, which of the following statements are correct? - Before transmitting blind, the aircraft station shall attempt to establish communication on the emergency channel. - After recognising the voice communication failure, the aircraft station shall attempt to establish contact on the previous channel used. - An aircraft operating within a network shall monitor the appropriate VHF channel for calls from nearby aircraft. - In case all other attempts fail to establish contact, the aircraft station shall send blind transmissions on the emergency channel.

VXLCEgbK.question: An aircraft is squawking 7600What does it indicate?

options.text: It is unable to establish communication due to radio equipment failure.
It is about to make a forced landing.
It is diverting to the alternate aerodrome.
It is requesting immediate level change.

zq1pHMdK.question: What action is required by the pilot of an aircraft  if he/she is unable to establish radio contact with an aeronautical station?

options.text: Try to establish communication with other aircraft or aeronautical stations.
Squawk mode A code 7500.
Divert to the alternate airport.
Land at the nearest aerodrome appropriate to the route of flight.

KrN8BR1H.question: You are flying under IFR, en route, and are experiencing communication failure. How would you proceed in this circumstance?

options.text: Weather permitting, proceed in VMC to the nearest suitable aerodrome, reporting your arrival by the most expeditious means to ATC.
Set the transponder code to 7700, change to VFR and complete the remainder of the flight in VMC,
Rock the aircraft wings, flash the navigational lights at irregular intervals, and perform radio checks to all possible stations.
Continue to maintain the last assigned speed and level for at least five minutes and set the transponder code to 7500.

mqlsRatx.question: Following a radio failure, the pilot tries to re-establish communications without success. All following transmissions are preceded by the phrase “Transmitting blind”. Which of the following statements are additional requirements regarding those blind transmissions? - Set the SSR code to **7500** - Repeat the message twice on the designated channel(s) - Include, if necessary, the name of the station being addressed - Deviate from the assigned route by at least 45˚

7NkBghFL.question:
In case of radio communication failure, which of the following statements is/are correct? 
1. A VFR flight can fly in Instrument Meteorological Conditions, as an exception. 
2. A VFR flight may, under certain circumstances, enter the relevant control zones. 
3. A VFR flight shall squawk 7600.

options.text: 2 and 3
1 and 3

ZiDSWY2f.question: All but one of the following elements are required to be transmitted when an aircraft station is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure. Which element can be excluded?

options.text: The frequency on which the message is transmitted.
A complete repetition of the intended message.
The time of the next intended transmission.
The phrase ”transmitting blind due to receiver failure”.

u1ZODw21.question: All but one of the following elements are required to be transmitted when an aircraft station is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure. Which element can be excluded?

options.text: The frequency on which the message is transmitted.
A complete repetition of the intended message.
The phrase “transmitting blind due to receiver failure”.
The time of the next intended transmission.

DGtPpAQg.question:
All but one of the following elements are required to be transmitted when an aircraft station is unable to establish communication due to receiver failure
Which element can be excluded?

options.text: The frequency on which the message is transmitted.
The phrase ”transmitting blind due to receiver failure”
The time of the next intended transmission.
A complete repetition of the intended message.

5NHcN7SX.question: An aircraft on an IFR flight in IMC conditions, and flying in airspace where radar service is provided, experiences radio communication failure. The PIC must set the transponder on 7600, maintain the last assigned speed and..

options.text: level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter, he/she must adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter he/she must adjust speed and level in accordance with the flight plan.
initiate a 300 ft per minute climb until reaching VMC conditions, then divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.
turn right by 30 degrees if flying odd flight levels, or turn left by 30 degrees if flying even flight levels.

7of4LyYQ.question: A flight crew hears a click on the com but no voice. Nevertheless the frequency is blocked. What is true?

options.text: The carrier wave is received but is not modulated.
The modulating wave is received but the carrier wave is missing.
An interference with another station calling has occurred.
The aircraft communications equipment has failed.

Whh4zIHZ.question: On a VFR flight in controlled airspace, a receiver failure of the radio occurs. Required actions by the pilot are: - Squawk **7500** and press IDENT. - Transmit reports at the scheduled times or positions. - Precede reports by the phrase "TRANSMITTNIG BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE". - Transmit the reports on the frequency in use. - Duplicate the reports on emergency frequency 121.5 MHz. - Leave the controlled airspace as soon as possible.

liMxkIzl.question: An aircraft station fails to establish radio contact with an aeronautical station on the designated frequency. What action is required by the pilot:

options.text: Attempt to establish contact with the station on an alternative frequency
Continue the flight to the destination airport without any communication
Return to the airport of departure
Land at the nearest airport without an ATC unit

eIuswzFI.question: In addition to attempting to establish communications with the appropriate air traffic control unit using all other available means, what should a pilot do if he/she is experiencing communication failure in the aerodrome traffic pattern at a controlled aerodrome?

options.text: Watch for instructions issued by visual signals.
Maintain the last assigned speed and level for at least 30 minutes.
Return to the aerodrome of departure.
Set the transponder code 7700.

XDnmf9bz.question: In case of a SSR transponder failure occurring after departure of an IFR flight, the pilot shall:

options.text: inform the competent ATC unit immediately.
land at the nearest suitable aerodrome for repair.
continue the flight in VMC.
squawk 7600.

9ZNScZsV.question: If all attempts to establish radio contact with a ground station fail, the pilot of an aeroplane shall transmit messages preceded by the phrase:

options.text: TRANSMITTING BLIND.
PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN.
HOW DO YOU READ?
READ YOU ONE, READ YOU ONE.

5YbzNVdX.question: If all attempts to establish radio contact with a ground station fail, the pilot of an aeroplane shall transmit messages preceded by the phrase:

options.text: Transmitting blind
Read you one, read you one
PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN
How do you read?

24vLGvhk.question: The expression ?transmitting blind due to receiver failure' implies that no answer is expectedIt is used by?

options.text: an aircraft aware of receiver failure.
a radar controller performing a PAR (Precision Approach Radar)or SRE (Surveillance Radar Equipment)final approach.
aground station broadcasting information to all listening stations.
an aircraft transmitting blind at a non-towered airfield.
